name: places/ChIJ8YZ0Dc1ZwokRm_WvP1Aktj0
formattedAddress: 787 11th Ave 7th Fl, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 787 11th Ave 7th Fl, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: In July of 2023, Dr. Kim performed a three level anterior cervical fusion surgery on my neck.  Everything went well, was in hospital just one night and wore a collar for ten weeks. After trying PT, chiropractor and other things for about 10 years, I'm happy that I went with this surgery and Dr. Kim, who also did surgery for a friend a few years ago for spinal cord injury, and came highly recommended.  Dr. Kim is very thorough, professional and also has a good sense of humor and hand shake, too!  I've been pain free for a few months now and no longer need any muscle relaxers or any medication and can sleep through the night and without a heating pad.  Also the x-rays are done on site, staff are very nice and it's a beautiful, new, state of the art facility on 11th Ave. very close to Mount Sinai West.

originalText.text: Dr Kim is an excellent doctor — it goes without saying that he is a skilled surgeon and his work relieved me of so much pain. But in addition to this, when he knew I was struggling, and after surgery, he called me on weekends so I knew that he was thinking about my care and helping to get me answers and solutions. Smart, kind, straightforward, 10/10.

originalText.text: I have struggled with low back pain for years. I used to train competitively for physique shows and eventually couldn't tie my own shoelaces. I had a 2 level anterior lumbar fusion elsewhere and got even worse. I've seen so many spine surgeries (doing Orthopedic Surgery myself) and everyone had a different opinion. I found Dr. Kim through a colleague and thank God I did. He did my posterior lumbar fusion and the very next day I had zero (old) back pain (just pain over incision sites). There's no one better, in my experience, when it comes to spine surgery. I would highly recommend to anyone to, at a minimum, have a consultation with Dr. Kim and then you can relax.

originalText.text:
Highly recommend Dr Kim. I had a 2 level microdiscectomy back in June that gave me a huge quality of life improvement. Prior to the surgery I was barely able to walk. Since July I've been averaging 10-15k steps a day.

I talked to a few surgeons before deciding to go with Dr Kim. I had a personal referral from a colleague whose disc issues he had also fixed. From talking with multiple surgeons (and getting second and third opinions on how to deal with my back pain) I particularly liked that he uses the most advanced modern minimally invasive techniques.

originalText.text: I’m so thankful to have found Dr. Kim! I have been suffering from herniated disc for a few years and lived in fear that my life will always be filled with pain. I’ve tried many ways to relieve pain through therapy, acupuncture, herbal medicine, steroid shots… you name it, I’ve tried it. I knew surgery was an option but I was never really informed of what that meant and it scared me. Although the thought of getting surgery was scary, my husband found Dr Kim and we went in for a consultation. Dr. Kim was very kind and he thoroughly explained my MRI results and the procedure I’d be a good candidate for. I decided to get the surgery and it has been almost two weeks since! I am feeling pain free, and hopeful!! I wish I had gotten this sooner in my life. It has been a pleasure to have Dr. Kim as my surgeon and his staffs are very attentive and the most kind people. I would definitely recommend to anyone who may be feeling lost and in pain, to consider giving Dr Kim a visit.
